N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 903.2 - Purposes

State Regulations
(a) Prior to the
issuance of a certificate of authority, authorization shall be granted by the
commissioner pursuant to section
903.4
of this Part to a
prospective applicant or an applicant for a certificate of authority for the
purposes of: (1)
testing the market demand
for the proposed community; and
(2)
allowing prospective residents to place their names on a waiting list for
admission to the proposed community and to apply the reservation fee on
priority basis to an actual entrance fee or entrance fee deposit if and when
the applicant is issued a certificate of authority pursuant to section
900.7
of this Title. (b) Subsequent to the issuance of
a certificate of authority, authorization may be granted by the commissioner
pursuant to section
903.4
of this Part to a life care
community operator for the purpose of allowing prospective residents to place
their names on a waiting list for admission to the community and to apply the
reservation fee on a priority basis to an actual entrance fee or entrance fee
deposit when a suitable unit becomes available. Notes
